bibl.title: Letter from Mabel H. Lazear to S.C. Mead, June 26, 1922

div1.p: Mabel Lazear expresses gratitude for what the Merchants' Association of New York has done for her.

div1.head: Letter from Mabel H. Lazear to S.C. Mead, June 26, 1922

opener.dateline:
218 E. Padre St.
Santa Barbara
Calif.

div1.p:
As you
may well imagine your
telegram was received
with great joy and
with more appreciation
than I can express
that you were so
kind and thoughtful
as to let me know
so promptly what had
been done in Washington.

With such an organiza-
tion working for my
interest I feel very
hopeful.

Will you please ex-
press to the members
of the N. Y. Merchants
Association my
gratitude for all they
are doing for me
and tell them how much it is
appreciated.

This morning June 26
I received your most
kind letter with
a copy of yours the
Surgeon General and
Mr. Anthony enclosed.

Again I can. only say
C1
B17
thank you hoping you will
realize how deeply I feel
your great kindness
in going to all this trouble

It was indeed a great
satisfaction to read your
letters and feel that as shown
by them my husband
Dr Lazear's work has not
been forgotten. Believe
me most appreciation of
your great kindness
div1.closer: Very sincerely Mabel N. Lazear June 26 1922
